text: [APPLAUSE]

When I was eight, my
grandfather taught me

how to throw a spiral
football for the first time.

He'd get tired,
and we'd go inside.

He'd take a cigarette
out of his mouth
and he put on his oxygen mask.
He died when I was 10.

And I don't remember
him any other way
than when he was sick.

When he was 40 years old,
we didn't have the tools
we have today to intervene.

Now, we do, but
nobody is innovating

for those we've neglected
the most at the highest risk,

blue collar workers and
low income individuals that
are the hardest to reach.
But we're reaching them.
We're skipping class.
We're sitting down with them.
We're listening to them.

And we're building
something for them.

The research shows the
financial incentives work,

but our carpenters
would tell us,
it's not just about the money.

I just want to dance with
my daughter at her wedding
one day.

So we listened to what
they said, built an app

to deliver real time incentives,
and behavioral support.

You blow into a device, if
you've not been smoking,
you get an instant reward.

We've done two pilots,
achieved a 93% engagement,

and there's four
other organizations
waiting to work with us.

This is a $50 billion problem
for self-insured employers,

but what we're learning in scale
to help millions of smokers

around the world and help us
manage other chronic conditions
like heart disease.

We're finally innovating for
those who we forgot to help.
So why isn't anyone doing this?

There's finally a team that
understands the research,

can iterate way faster
than the speed of academia.

We figured out the
business model.

And we're passionate enough
to do this full time.
We're Vincere Health.
[APPLAUSE]
